name: Ali Seydi Keçeli
content: HomeSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationAli Seydi KeçeliHacettepe UniversityComputer Engineering Department06800 Beytepe, Ankara, Turkey Office: Z17-BPhone: +90 321 29775 00 Fax: +90 312 297 7502Personal Information I am currently working as a Assoc. Prof.  at the Computer Engineering Department in Hacettepe University in Ankara. I received the BSc degree from Hacettepe University, Department of Computer Engineering. I also received my MSc (2007) and PhD (2015) degree from the same department. Before starting my master and Phd studies in the same department i worked as software engineer in military projects. My main research areas are image processing, computer vision, data mining, and software engineering. E-mail    : aliseydi [at] cs.hacettepe.edu.trResearch InterestsComputer Vision and Image Processing, Data mining, GPU programming with CUDA, Software Engineering , Game Technologies Journal Publications •Keceli, A. Human Motion Sensitive Patient and Personel Security System in Radiation Therapy, Medical Physics Conference, İzmirREVIEWER  FOR JOURNALS·       IEEE Transactions On Image Processing- SCI ·        Computers & Geosciences  - SCI ·        IEEE Transactions On Cybernetics - SCI ·        IEEE Transactions on Man Systems and Cybernetics - SCIE·        IEEE Signal Processing Letters - SCIE·        IET Electronic Letters - SCI ·        IET Generation, Transmission and Distribution - SCIE·        Turkish Journal of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences - SCIE·        Informatics in Medicine Unlocked·        KSII Transactions on Internet and Information Systems -SCIE·        ETRI Journal-SCIE·        PeerJ·        Signal Image& Video Processing·        Computer & Electronics in Agriculture·        Ecological Informatics·        IEEE Access·        IET Computer Vision· Journal of Ambient Intelligence and Humanized Computing· Computational Intelligence and Neuroscience· The Computer Journal· Virtual Reality & Intelligent HardwarePROJECTSAISym4MED  06/2023 -Support: EurostarPosition:  ConsultantInfo: AISym4MED is a European Union Project aiming to overcome the challenges faced when using data from multiple data sources and to develop and perfect consumer-ready AI solutions. The project aims to mitigate the problems of using AI by using new solutions to reduce the impact of overfitting effects, as well as to advance secure data processing tools for widespread availability, data quality control and GDPR compliance.EDIT: EYE TRACKING BASED DYSLEXIA DIAGNOSTIC SYSTEM  12/2023- Support: TÜBİTAK TeydebPosition:  ConsultantInfo:  In this project, various deeplearning models is being developed to  predict dyslexia using eye movement features.Sisowiser  06/2022- 06/2023Support: TÜBİTAK TeydebPosition:  ConsultantInfo:Social Support Assistant for Blind and Visually Impaired People 06/2015 -08/2016 Support: Science, Industry and Technology MinistryPosition:  ConsultantInfo: In this project, a device for blind and visually impaired people is being developed.
